results.title: The F-111 story
results.brief_description: The development of the F-111 airplane with its controversial variable swing wing construction. A pioneer in aircraft design…shows scenes of flight testing, and demonstrations of this aircraft’s capabilities.

results.title: Ezra Jack Keats
results.creator_credit: Cynthia Freitag, Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: This film introduces the personality and style of Ezra Jack Keats, Caldecott Medallist, author and illustrator of well-known picture books. It concludes with an iconographic film rendition of one of his books “A Letter to Amy”.

results.title: Eye = L'oeil
results.creator_credit: Viviane Elnecave, Pierre Moretti and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Inwardly, eyes may be the windows of the soul, but when the gaze is directed outward, they become much more than organs for perceiving the world around - they become also an instrument of involvement in all of life’s drama. In this highly imaginative animation film, one disembodied eye (one is all that it takes) embarks on life’s adventures, entering into and disengaging from all the many passions, vicissitudes and conflicts that beset one’s course. Music by Maurice Blackburn and sound by Michel Descombes.

results.title: Eyes: their structure and care [B&W]
results.brief_description: A farsighted young boy visits an optometrist and learns about the importance of protecting his eyes. The optometrist reviews the structure of the eyes, explains how the optical system functions, and discusses the cause of myopia, hyperopia, and astigmatism. Describes the work of an optometrist, an ophthalmologist, and an optician.

results.title: The Eyes have it...or do they?
results.brief_description: Explores the major aspects of vision and the way in which it determines one’s conception of the world. Suggests that physically different eyes perceive reality differently. Shows the influence of physical and chemical stiumlation on the eye and discusses sensitivity to color, light, shadow, form and line.

results.title: The Eyes have it
results.creator_credit: Dave Gilbert, Interkal Productions and National Society for the Prevention of Blindness
results.brief_description: Marionettes led by an owl accompanied by a piano playing fox and the fern forest orchestra sing a song of advice about eye care. Other marionettes act out the words of the song. Later the song is repeated, with some different activities while the words are flashed on the screen.

results.title: Eyes and their care
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description: The structure, functioning, physiology and hygiene of the eyes are studied, the following in detail: learning how to judge distance; eye movements; light receptors; field of vision; night blindness; double vision; near and far sightedness; infections of and protection for the eyes.

results.title: Eye Witness. No. 93
results.creator_credit: Hector Lemieux, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This is an inside story of the trucking business from the point of view of a driver of one of the huge long-distance trailer transports. He describes his customary 388-mile run between Montreal and New York and, in the process, shows what a highly organized operation trucking has become.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hector Lemieux, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada
